200.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability.
200.flavor: I've gathered all the jarls together. Now make your case.

201.name: Draig Bon-Dhu
201.ability: Deploy: Boost all Warrior allies by 1.
201.ability_html: Deploy: Boost all Warrior allies by 1.
201.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
201.flavor: Hear ye now the tale of the heroic deeds of Clan an Craite.

202.name: Gremist
202.ability: Deploy, Ranged: Play a bronze Alchemy card from your graveyard.
202.ability_html: Deploy, Ranged: Play a bronze Alchemy card from your graveyard.
202.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
202.flavor: An archdruid, a master of alchemy, and the grumpiest old fart in the Isles.

203.name: Holger Blackhand
203.ability:
Whenever you play a Ship, boost it by 1.
Whenever you play a Pirate, damage a random enemy by 1.
203.ability_html:
Whenever you play a Ship, boost it by 1.
Whenever you play a Pirate, damage a random enemy by 1.
203.flavor: Now let's drink to the Emperor of Nilfgaard – may he die of somethin' hideous!

204.name: Jutta an Dimun
204.ability: Deploy: If Jutta an Dimun is the highest unit, damage self by 6.
204.ability_html: Deploy: If Jutta an Dimun is the highest unit, damage self by 6.
204.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
204.flavor: Some call her the Iron Maiden.

205.name: Morkvarg
205.ability: When this unit moves to the graveyard, Summon it to the melee row and give it Doomed.
205.ability_html: When this unit moves to the graveyard, Summon it to the melee row and give it Doomed.
205.keyword_html: Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game after it moves to the graveyard.
205.flavor: The vilest man Skellige's ever known.

206.name: Savage Bear
206.ability:
Zeal.
Deploy: Gain 1 Charge for each Savage Bear in the graveyard.
Order: Damage a unit by 2.
Charge: 1.

212.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.

214.ability_html: Order: If this unit takes damage, Spawn a base copy of it and Summon it to the right.

215.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Discard: Move a card from your hand to the graveyard. Note: Related abilities are not triggered when discarding manually.
215.flavor: The deeds of Clan Heymaey will go down in history.

Order: Damage self and an enemy by 1.

217.name: Freya's Blessing
217.ability: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard.
217.ability_html: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard.
217.flavor: Modron Freya, the Great Mother, is the goddess of love, beauty and bounty.

218.name: An Craite Blacksmith
218.ability:
Order: Boost an ally by 1. 
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a Warrior.

220.flavor: Friends we show heart, foes we show our axe. Remember that.

221.ability_html: Whenever your opponent plays a unit, damage it by 1.
221.keyword_html: Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.

222.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
222.flavor: So ye can hit a movin' target at two hundred paces? Me, too. In a storm.

223.name: Gutting Slash
223.ability:
Damage a unit by 4. 
Bloodthirst 2: Damage a unit by 6 instead.
223.ability_html: Damage a unit by 4. Bloodthirst 2: Damage a unit by 6 instead.
223.keyword_html: Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability.
223.flavor: Man or tree, a Skelligan axe fells it all the same.

225.flavor: They'll shatter on our shields like waves on a craggy shore.

226.name: Delirium

226.ability_html: Split 6 damage randomly between all units on an enemy row.
226.flavor: Ehh, too big for a humpback. That's a finback. A finback? With a snout that short? Those herbs've gone to your head!

227.name: Elder Bear
227.flavor: We're going on a bear hunt! We're going to catch a–– THAT THING'S HUGE! RUN!

228.name: Raging Bear
228.ability: Deploy: Damage an ally to the left by 1. If there is no ally, damage self by 1 instead.
228.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an ally to the left by 1. If there is no ally, damage self by 1 instead.

229.ability_html: Heal all units on a row.
229.keyword_html: Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
229.flavor: Those cursed sorceresses are stealing our thunder! Whyever should folk choose a procedure taking several hours, when some perfumed tart can solve their problem with a wave of her hand?

230.name: Lacerate
230.ability: Damage all units on a row by 2.
230.ability_html: Damage all units on a row by 2.
230.flavor: A sight more horrid you've never seen… The poor soul lay shredded as the beast lapped up its blood from the ground all around.

231.name: Letho of Gulet
231.ability: Deploy: Remove all redraws from the enemy Leader.
231.ability_html: Deploy: Remove all redraws from the enemy Leader.
231.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
231.flavor: Witchers never die in their beds.

232.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
232.flavor: I'll take an attentive reconnaissance unit over a fine brigade any day.

233.ability: Order, Melee: Seize a Locked enemy unit.

Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Seize: Move an enemy to the opposite row. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
233.flavor: There's never been a problem a well–planned assassination couldn't solve.

234.name: Cahir Dyffryn
234.ability: Melee: Whenever an enemy receives a boost, boost self by the same amount.
234.ability_html: Melee: Whenever an enemy receives a boost, boost self by the same amount.
234.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.

235.ability:
Deploy, Melee: Destroy an enemy unit, then your opponent Summons the top unit from their deck to a random enemy row.

235.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Destroy an enemy unit, then your opponent Summons the top unit from their deck to a random enemy row. Deploy, Ranged: Destroy an allied unit, then Summon the top unit from your deck to a random allied row.

236.name: Stefan Skellen
236.ability: Order: Spawn and play a copy of a Tactic card you played on this turn.
236.ability_html: Order: Spawn and play a copy of a Tactic card you played on this turn.

236.flavor: My mark scars the face of our future empress. That is my proudest achievement.

237.ability_html: Deploy: Your opponent Summons the top unit from their deck to a random enemy row.
237.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
237.flavor: Tibor's zeal was legendary. It was said when the emperor passed, he'd not so much bow as somersault.

238.name: Xarthisius
238.ability: Deploy: Reveal a random card in your deck. If it's a unit, boost self by its power and shuffle it back. If it's an artifact or a special card, play it.
238.ability_html: Deploy: Reveal a random card in your deck. If it's a unit, boost self by its power and shuffle it back. If it's an artifact or a special card, play it.

238.flavor: Astrology, hydromancy, haruspicy, ceromancy. Ovomancy, spodomancy, metroscopy, brontoscopy…

242.ability: Deploy: Restore a unit to its base power.
242.ability_html: Deploy: Restore a unit to its base power.
242.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.

243.ability_html: Order: Reveal a random special card from your opponent's deck, then Spawn and play a copy of it.

243.flavor: Magic is the highest good. It transcends all borders and divisions.

244.name: Sweers
244.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy by 1.
Increase this unit's damage by 1 for each card you have Revealed.

245.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
245.flavor: For a fire mage, he's not very… flamboyant.

246.name: Auckes

Deploy: Lock an enemy unit.
If Serrit is in your hand, Lock all copies of that unit in the opponent's hand, deck, and on their side of the battlefield.

246.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
246.flavor: Letho's got a plan… what could go wrong?

247.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 3. If Auckes is in your hand, damage that unit by 5 instead.
247.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
247.flavor: We do what we must. I am not ashamed of that.

248.name: Cantarella
248.ability:
Spying.
Deploy: Play the top card from your opponent's deck.
248.ability_html: Spying. Deploy: Play the top card from your opponent's deck.
248.keyword_html: Spying: Status for a unit played on or moved to the opposite side of the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
248.flavor: Men require constant alluring. Mystique and refinement do the job quite well.

249.name: Joachim de Wett
249.ability:
Spying.
Deploy: Play the top non-Spying unit from your deck, then boost it by 8.
249.ability_html: Spying. Deploy: Play the top non-Spying unit from your deck, then boost it by 8.
249.keyword_html: Spying: Status for a unit played on or moved to the opposite side of the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
249.flavor: To describe the manner in which Duke de Wett led the Verden Group as incompetent would be far too kind.

250.name: False Ciri

Deploy, Melee: Move an enemy to the other row.
Deploy, Ranged: Destroy an enemy artifact.

250.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
250.flavor: Here she comes, he thought, our imperial interest. A mock-princess, a mock-queen for Cintra. A mock-ruler for the mouth of the Yarra, future lifeblood of the empire.

251.name: Ceallach Dyffryn
251.ability: Deploy:  Remove all statuses from all units on the battlefield.
251.ability_html: Deploy: Remove all statuses from all units on the battlefield.
251.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
251.flavor: Your Imperial Highness… blurted out the seneschal, whose presence until now had been thoroughly ignored. I beg your pardon, but Cahir… My son...

252.name: Daerlan Soldier

252.ability_html: When you Reveal this unit, Summon it from your deck to a random allied row.
252.keyword_html: Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
252.flavor: Learned a lot at Braibant Military Academy. How to scrub potatoes, for instance.

253.name: Rot Tosser

253.ability_html: Deploy, Ranged: Spawn and play a Cow Carcass.
253.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
253.flavor: Let historians debate whether spreading plague in a besieged city is ethical. We just care if it's effective.

254.name: Spotter
254.ability: Deploy, Melee: Reveal a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
254.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Reveal a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
254.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
254.flavor: The North has nothing with which it could surprise us.

255.name: Experimental Remedy
255.ability: Play a bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard.
255.ability_html: Play a bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard.
255.flavor: Well... At least, I can't make you more dead...

256.name: Deithwen Arbalest
256.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2, then Reveal a random unit from both decks. If yours has more power, repeat the Deploy ability.
256.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2, then Reveal a random unit from both decks. If yours has more power, repeat the Deploy ability.
256.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
256.flavor: I aim for the knees. Always.

Order, Ranged: Damage a unit by 1.

Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a Tactic card.

Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
257.flavor: Name's terribly misleading, makes it sound like some corpulent reddish arachnid, not an exquisitely engineered weapon of mass destruction...

258.name: Impera Brigade
258.ability: Deploy, Melee: Summon a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.
258.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Summon a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.

Order: Damage an enemy by 2.
Charge: 1.
Gain 1 Charge whenever you play a Spying unit.

Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.

260.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.

261.name: Nauzicaa Brigade
261.ability: Deploy: Damage a boosted enemy by 3.
261.ability_html: Deploy: Damage a boosted enemy by 3.

265.name: Emissary

Spying.

268.name: Mangonel

269.name: Nilfgaardian Knight

270.name: The Guardian
270.flavor: Stone fists to stop intruders armed with swords. Ironclad logic to stop those armed with lies.

271.name: Cow Carcass
271.ability:
Spying. Doomed.
After 1 turn, on turn end, destroy this unit and the unit on its left.
271.ability_html: Spying. Doomed. After 1 turn, on turn end, destroy this unit and the unit on its left.
271.keyword_html: Spying: Status for a unit played on or moved to the opposite side of the battlefield. Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game after it moves to the graveyard.
271.flavor: That a bird? That a griffin? Naye! That's a…

272.name: Treason
272.ability: Force an enemy unit to damage adjacent units by its own power.
272.ability_html: Force an enemy unit to damage adjacent units by its own power.
272.flavor: In Nilfgaard, trustful people are considered an endangered species.

273.name: Bribery
273.ability: Create a unit from your opponent's starting deck, then play it.
273.ability_html: Create a unit from your opponent's starting deck, then play it.
273.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.
273.flavor: Many believe the empire's power rests upon the shoulders of its disciplined army and dutiful mages. In truth, the Nilfgaardian floren rules the world.

274.name: Petri's Philter
274.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Boost an ally by 3 and give it Zeal.
274.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Boost an ally by 3 and give it Zeal.
274.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
274.flavor: A mage responsible for dozens of brilliant inventions. The mind of a generation. Commonly referred to around the Continent as that bloke with the dish.

275.name: Korathi Heatwave
275.ability: Banish a unit or an artifact.
275.ability_html: Banish a unit or an artifact.
275.keyword_html: Banish: Remove from the game. Does not trigger Deathwish abilities.
275.flavor: Vicovaro scholars have determined that, in the absence of imperial aid, drought-stricken provinces lose half their population, two-thirds of their livestock and all their will to rebel.

276.name: Marching Orders
276.ability: Play the lowest unit from your deck.
276.ability_html: Play the lowest unit from your deck.
276.flavor: We are but pawns in a game played by old men, sent to fight and die on their senile whims…

277.name: Necromancy
277.ability: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
277.ability_html: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
277.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game after it moves to the graveyard.
277.flavor: We have ways of making you talk… alive or dead.

278.name: Summoning Circle
278.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Play a unit from your deck whose Recruit Cost is less than or equal to Summoning Circle's Charge count, then remove all Charges.
Charge: 0.
Every turn, on turn start, gain 1 Charge.
278.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Play a unit from your deck whose Recruit Cost is less than or equal to Summoning Circle's Charge count, then remove all Charges. Charge: 0. Every turn, on turn start, gain 1 Charge.
278.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
278.flavor: There exist a great many realities outside our own… With the right knowledge, one can contact them and summon beings beyond human fathoming.

279.name: Arachas Venom
279.ability: Damage a unit by 3. If it was destroyed, damage its adjacent units by 3.
279.ability_html: Damage a unit by 3. If it was destroyed, damage its adjacent units by 3.
279.flavor: If substance makes contact with eyes, rinse immediately with cold water, then commence drawing up will.

280.name: Wild Hunt Navigator
280.ability: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 1. If you control the highest unit, boost by 3 instead.
280.ability_html: Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 1. If you control the highest unit, boost by 3 instead.
280.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
280.flavor: For hundreds of years, Avallac'h tried to recreate the Elder Blood gene through back breeding - yet the elven children thus fostered were but dim sparks compared to Lara's flame.

281.name: Vabjorn
281.ability: Deploy, Melee: Destroy a damaged enemy.
281.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Destroy a damaged enemy.
281.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
281.flavor: Blood for Svalblod! Skulls for his throne!

282.name: Milaen
282.ability:
Deploy, Melee: Damage an enemy by 4.
Deploy, Ranged: Damage 4 enemies by 1.
282.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Damage an enemy by 4. Deploy, Ranged: Damage 4 enemies by 1.
282.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
282.flavor: The old baron treated poachers mercilessly. Luckily for Milaen, the old baron was dead and his men, desperate outlaws.

283.name: Leo Bonhart
283.ability:
Deploy, Melee: Destroy an enemy with 8 or more power.
Deploy, Ranged: Destroy a Witcher.
283.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Destroy an enemy with 8 or more power. Deploy, Ranged: Destroy a Witcher.
283.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
283.flavor: He would just sit there and stare at me, not saying a word. His eyes, they were… fish-like, somehow. No brows, no lashes… Just these balls of water, with a black stone sunk in each. He would devour me with those eyes in total silence. That frightened me more than the beatings.

284.name: Rainfarn of Attre
284.ability: Deploy: Boost an enemy by 3, then boost self by 3.
284.ability_html: Deploy: Boost an enemy by 3, then boost self by 3.
284.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
284.flavor: When Cintra fell, Attre followed, leaving its defenders a choice: accept the Nilfgaardian leash or die.

285.name: Aretuza Adept
285.ability:
Zeal.
Order, Ranged: Give 1 Charge to an allied unit.
Cooldown: 2.
285.ability_html: Zeal. Order, Ranged: Give 1 Charge to an allied unit. Cooldown: 2.
285.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
285.flavor: The adepts' every whim is catered to - they live like princesses at Aretuza. And in turn half the city lives off servicing them: seamstresses, milliners, confectioners, delivery boys…

286.name: Drummond Warmonger
286.ability: Deploy, Melee, Bloodthirst 1: Destroy an enemy artifact.
286.ability_html: Deploy, Melee, Bloodthirst 1: Destroy an enemy artifact.
286.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability.
286.flavor: Think o' the greater good?! War's the greatest good, the greatest bad, the greatest damn anythin' man's ever come up with!

287.name: Cyclops
287.ability: Deploy: Destroy an adjacent allied unit and damage an enemy by its power.
287.ability_html: Deploy: Destroy an adjacent allied unit and damage an enemy by its power.
287.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
287.flavor: Don't stare at his eye, he hates that…

288.name: Archespore
288.ability:
Thrive.
Deploy: Damage a random enemy by 2. 
Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
288.ability_html: Thrive. Deploy: Damage a random enemy by 2. Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
288.keyword_html: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 whenever an ally with higher power is played. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
288.flavor: Folklore claims they sprout from soil watered with the blood of the dying. Thus they flourish in grounds consecrated by pogroms, dark rituals or brutal murders.

289.name: Dol Blathanna Sentry
289.ability:
Melee: Whenever an enemy is moved to the other row, damage it by 1.
Ranged: Whenever an ally is moved to the other row, boost it by 1.
289.ability_html: Melee: Whenever an enemy is moved to the other row, damage it by 1. Ranged: Whenever an ally is moved to the other row, boost it by 1.
289.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
289.flavor: As long as we stand, no human foot shall trample Dol Blathanna's meadows.

290.name: An Craite Greatsword
290.ability: Whenever an enemy on the opposite row takes damage, boost self by 1.
290.ability_html: Whenever an enemy on the opposite row takes damage, boost self by 1.
290.flavor: Ahh, ye gave me a good laugh there, Nordling! Why, this bastard, ye couldn't even grip it, let alone gut me with it.

291.name: Hefty Helge
291.ability:
Immune.
Order: Damage an enemy by 2 for each Soldier on this row.
291.ability_html: Immune. Order: Damage an enemy by 2 for each Soldier on this row.
291.keyword_html: Immune: Cannot be targeted. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
291.flavor: Not the best for taking cities, but great for razing them to the ground.

292.name: Mahakam Marauder
292.ability: Deploy: If this unit is already boosted, gain Resilience.
292.ability_html: Deploy: If this unit is already boosted, gain Resilience.
292.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the board at round end, then restores it to base power if boosted.
292.flavor: Hunting on Mahakam's craggy cliffs is not particularly easy… but nor are dwarves particularly put off by danger.

293.name: Harald Houndsnout
293.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 3 of Harald's Pals and Summon them to your other allied row.
Order: Damage an ally by 1.
Cooldown: 1.
293.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn 3 of Harald's Pals and Summon them to your other allied row. Order: Damage an ally by 1. Cooldown: 1.
293.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
293.flavor: Once proud jarl of Clan Tordarroch, now a muttering madman.

294.name: Magne Division
294.ability: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1 if this is the only card on this row.
294.ability_html: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1 if this is the only card on this row.
294.flavor: I know the Emperor defends all his lands... but a garrison in this blasted waste is like a chastity belt on a grave hag.

295.name: Tuirseach Veteran
295.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
295.flavor: In my days I've seen wonders no man's ever dreamt of, and done things no man should ever do.

296.name: Ban Ard Tutor
296.ability: Deploy: Boost an ally by 1 for each of its Charges.
296.ability_html: Deploy: Boost an ally by 1 for each of its Charges.
296.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
296.flavor: I'm constantly comparing the achievements of Aretuza's adepts with the work done by the lads at Ban Ard, and my conclusion constantly falls in favor of the girls.

297.name: Battering Ram
297.ability: Deploy: If you control a Soldier, destroy an enemy artifact.
297.ability_html: Deploy: If you control a Soldier, destroy an enemy artifact.
297.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
297.flavor: Not gonna open up, eh? Guess we gotta knock harder.

298.name: Vreemde
298.ability: Deploy: Boost a Soldier ally and all copies of it by 2.
298.ability_html: Deploy: Boost a Soldier ally and all copies of it by 2.
298.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
298.flavor: The Great Sun shall warm the North with its rays, even if it means I must slaughter you all!

299.name: Golyat
299.ability: Deathwish: Your opponent Summons the lowest unit from their deck on the opposite row.
299.ability_html: Deathwish: Your opponent Summons the lowest unit from their deck on the opposite row.
299.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
299.flavor: Some claim Golyat was once a famous knight. Sadly, one day he earned the wrath of the Lady of the Lake, who turned him into a monster.

300.name: Artefact Compression
300.ability: Lock a unit and restore it to its base power.
300.ability_html: Lock a unit and restore it to its base power.
300.keyword_html: Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
300.flavor: The figurine expanded in a flash, pulsing and throbbing, changing its shape and structure like a puff of smoke crawling over the floor. Beams of light revealed movement and hardening materials. A moment later, in the center of the magic circle a human form suddenly appeared.

301.name: Unseen Elder
301.ability:
Order: Trigger an ally's Deathwish ability.
On round start, refresh this ability.
301.ability_html: Order: Trigger an ally's Deathwish ability. On round start, refresh this ability.
301.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
301.flavor: No one, not even among the higher vampires, knows exactly how old the Unseen Elder is. They only know they should never, under any circumstances, defy his will.

302.name: Aguara: True Form
302.ability: Deploy, Ranged: Create any special card.
302.ability_html: Deploy, Ranged: Create any special card.
302.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.
302.flavor: Ever heard of an anterion? Think of it as the opposite of a lycanthrope: a beast which can take on human form.

303.name: Uma's Curse
303.ability: Create and play a gold unit.
303.ability_html: Create and play a gold unit.
303.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.
303.flavor: I give you three solid leads, trails as fresh as morning dew, the aid of my spies and my court sorceress. Yet in my daughter's stead, you bring me this… monstrosity?

304.name: Aguara
304.ability:
Deploy, Melee: Lock a unit.
Deploy, Ranged: Remove a unit's Lock.
304.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Lock a unit. Deploy, Ranged: Remove a unit's Lock.
304.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
304.flavor: Smarten up right now, or it's off to an aguara with you!

305.name: Shilard Fitz-Oesterlen
305.ability: Deploy: Set the power of the highest unit in your opponent's hand to 1.
305.ability_html: Deploy: Set the power of the highest unit in your opponent's hand to 1.
305.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
305.flavor: A diplomat is a man who uses many more words than necessary to express much less than he knows.

306.name: Adda: Striga
306.ability: Deploy: If you control the highest unit, damage an enemy by 5.
306.ability_html: Deploy: If you control the highest unit, damage an enemy by 5.
306.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
306.flavor: And the striga's doin' fine. Sure, she takes a bite outta someone from time to time, but you get used to that.

307.name: Trial of the Grasses
307.ability: Boost a unit to 12 power. If it's not a Witcher, damage it by 6 first.
307.ability_html: Boost a unit to 12 power. If it's not a Witcher, damage it by 6 first.
307.flavor: Imagine a lump of clay. In order to shape it, you must first moisten it or it will crumble. The Trial's initial part does just that. It opens the body to change, so to speak. Only then can the mutagens produce a witcher.

308.name: Hanmarvyn's Blue Dream
308.ability: Play a unit from the opponent's graveyard and give it Doomed.
308.ability_html: Play a unit from the opponent's graveyard and give it Doomed.
308.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game after it moves to the graveyard.
308.flavor: This spell lets you see the last moments of a dead man's life… if you can survive its casting.

309.name: Xavier Moran
309.ability: Melee: Whenever this unit receives a boost, boost it by an additional 2.
309.ability_html: Melee: Whenever this unit receives a boost, boost it by an additional 2.
309.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
309.flavor: Well? Somethin' wrong? Venison a wee bit rank for ye? Ehh, princess?

310.name: Heymaey Herbalist
310.ability: Deploy, Ranged: Heal an ally by 2, then boost it by 2.
310.ability_html: Deploy, Ranged: Heal an ally by 2, then boost it by 2.
310.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
310.flavor: We don't burn cunning women in Skellige - we take their advice.

311.name: Iris' Companions
311.ability: Deploy: Draw a card of your choice from your deck, then Discard a random card.
311.ability_html: Deploy: Draw a card of your choice from your deck, then Discard a random card.
311.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Discard: Move a card from your hand to the graveyard. Note: Related abilities are not triggered when discarding manually.
311.flavor: We'd rather keep our names to ourselves. Think of us as… friends of the house.

312.name: Dorregaray of Vole
312.ability_html: Deploy: Lock a unit.
312.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
312.flavor: Like the witchers, Dorregaray is a monster aficionado, though he's developed his own classification system. Instead of dividing them into necrophages, ogroids and the like, he just thinks they're all wonderful.

313.name: Hubert Rejk
313.ability: Deploy: Boost self by the amount of damage you dealt to enemies on this turn.
313.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by the amount of damage you dealt to enemies on this turn.
313.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
313.flavor: The coroner is a calm, peaceful person. He even treats corpses with the utmost delicacy.

314.name: Nivellen
314.ability: Deploy: Move all units from one row to the other row.
314.ability_html: Deploy: Move all units from one row to the other row.
314.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
314.flavor: Lost? Well, go be lost somewhere else. Somewhere not on my property, that is. Point your left ear to the sun and keep walking, you'll hit the road soon enough. Well? What're you waiting for?

315.name: Stregobor
315.ability: Ranged: After 2 turns, each player draws a unit and sets its power to 1
315.ability_html: Ranged: After 2 turns, each player draws a unit and sets its power to 1
315.keyword_html: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
315.flavor: The witcher had met thieves that looked like town councilors, town councilors that looked like beggars and kings that looked like thieves. Stregobor, though, always looked exactly like the commonly accepted imagining of a what a mage should look like.

316.name: Vincent Meis
316.ability:
Zeal.
Order, Melee: Set the power of a non-boosted enemy to 1.
316.ability_html: Zeal. Order, Melee: Set the power of a non-boosted enemy to 1.
316.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
316.flavor: By day, Captain of the Vizima City Guard. By night, merciless avenger and defender of the downtrodden.

317.name: Hym
317.ability: Deploy: Swap this unit's power with a damaged unit's power.
317.ability_html: Deploy: Swap this unit's power with a damaged unit's power.
317.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
317.flavor: The gods' speak to me… I hear them whisper from the shadows…

318.name: Olaf
318.ability: Order: Boost Olaf by twice the amount he is damaged.
318.ability_html: Order: Boost Olaf by twice the amount he is damaged.
318.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
318.flavor: 10-time winner of the venerable title of Champion of the An Skellig Arena.

319.name: Ulfhedinn
319.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy by half of its current power.
319.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by half of its current power.
319.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
319.flavor: Werewolf? Oh, no, no… this is something far, far worse.

320.name: Dimun Warship
320.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 1 three times.
320.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 1 three times.
320.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
320.flavor: Clan Dimun warships are light and fast, perfect for racing down slow merchant frigates.

321.name: Siren
321.ability: Deploy: Boost a Deathwish ally by 3.
321.ability_html: Deploy: Boost a Deathwish ally by 3.
321.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
321.flavor: Legends claim they lure sailors to their doom with their entrancing songs… though more likely, the sailors were more entranced by their other ample charms.

322.name: Alpha Werewolf
322.keyword_html: Immune: Cannot be targeted. Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 whenever an ally with higher power is played.
322.flavor: Some say lycanthropy's contagious - get bit by a werewolf, you turn into one yourself. Witchers know that's nonsense, of course - only a powerful curse can bring on this condition.

323.name: Assassination
323.ability: Damage a unit by 6. Decrease the damage by 1 for each unit adjacent to it.
323.ability_html: Damage a unit by 6. Decrease the damage by 1 for each unit adjacent to it.
323.flavor: Assassin — one of the most popular professions at the imperial court, just after scribe and courtesan.

324.name: Infiltrator
324.ability: Melee: On round end, shuffle this unit into your opponent's deck.
324.ability_html: Melee: On round end, shuffle this unit into your opponent's deck.
324.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
324.flavor: You can run, but you'll never hide.

325.name: Viper Witcher
325.ability: Deploy: Reveal the top card from your opponent's deck and Banish it.
325.ability_html: Deploy: Reveal the top card from your opponent's deck and Banish it.
325.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck. Banish: Remove from the game. Does not trigger Deathwish abilities.
325.flavor: The School of the Viper shall be reborn… Letho saw to that.

326.name: Pyrotechnician
326.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Destroy an allied artifact and damage a unit by 2. 
Cooldown: 2.
326.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Destroy an allied artifact and damage a unit by 2. Cooldown: 2.
326.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
326.flavor: An extraordinarily risky, and thus much revered, Mahakam trade. Its best-known practitioner was a dwarf by the name of Mikkel Bay.

327.name: Farseer
327.ability: Deploy, Ranged: Reveal a random card from your deck. If it's a special card, boost self by 2.
327.ability_html: Deploy, Ranged: Reveal a random card from your deck. If it's a special card, boost self by 2.
327.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
327.flavor: Her words might seem unintelligible at times, but they always contain hidden meanings and tremendous wisdom.

328.name: Sage
328.ability: Whenever you play a special card, boost self by 2.
328.ability_html: Whenever you play a special card, boost self by 2.
328.flavor: Knowledge, my dear, is a privilege, and privileges are only shared among equals.

329.name: Panther
329.ability: Deploy: Damage a non-Scoia'tael enemy unit by 3.
329.ability_html: Deploy: Damage a non-Scoia'tael enemy unit by 3.
329.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
329.flavor: An Oxenfurt scholar once examined a panther and declared it was nothing more than a leopard of a different color. The panther seemed indifferent to this pronouncement and gobbled him up before he could complete his research.

330.name: Tuirseach Bearmaster
330.ability: Deploy: Boost a Beast ally by 2. Increase the boost by 1 for every Beast in your graveyard.
330.ability_html: Deploy: Boost a Beast ally by 2. Increase the boost by 1 for every Beast in your graveyard.
330.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
330.flavor: Don't touch him. Don't look him in the eyes. In fact… don't go anywhere near him.

331.name: Dimun Corsair
331.ability: Deploy: Damage a unit by 1 for every Ship in your hand.
331.ability_html: Deploy: Damage a unit by 1 for every Ship in your hand.
331.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
331.flavor: The sea's ours, along with everythin' that floats, swims or sails in it!

332.name: Dimun Smuggler
332.ability: Deploy, Melee: Damage a unit by 1, then boost the same unit by 2.
332.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Damage a unit by 1, then boost the same unit by 2.
332.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
332.flavor: Spikeroog's a barren backwater, but that don't bother us - everythin' we need, we take from you.

333.name: Heymaey Flaminica
333.ability: Every turn, on turn end, Heal all damaged allies on this row by 1.
333.ability_html: Every turn, on turn end, Heal all damaged allies on this row by 1.
333.keyword_html: Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
333.flavor: A flaminica, the highest position among the druidesses, commands a great deal of respect and wields a great deal of power.

334.name: Heymaey Protector
334.ability: Whenever an adjacent unit takes damage, boost self by 1.
334.ability_html: Whenever an adjacent unit takes damage, boost self by 1.
334.flavor: He fears nothing save Freya's wrath... and his wife's.

335.name: Royal Decree
335.ability: Play a unit from your deck.
335.ability_html: Play a unit from your deck.
335.flavor: We, Foltest, by divine right King of Temeria, Prince of Sodden, Senior Protector of Brugge, etcetera, etcetera, do hereby decree the following…

336.name: Bran Tuirseach
336.ability:
Order: Discard a card, then draw a card.
On round start, refresh this ability.
Whenever you Discard a card, damage a random enemy by 1.
336.ability_html: Order: Discard a card, then draw a card. On round start, refresh this ability. Whenever you Discard a card, damage a random enemy by 1.
336.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Discard: Move a card from your hand to the graveyard. Note: Related abilities are not triggered when discarding manually.
336.flavor: No one can replace Bran. Though they're sure to try.

337.name: Crach an Craite
337.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by 1. 
Cooldown: 2.
337.ability_html: Order: Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 2.
337.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
337.flavor: Nilfgaardians call 'im Tirth ys Muire, the Wild Boar o' the Sea. Use 'im to scare their kiddies!

338.name: Harald the Cripple
338.ability: Order: Split 8 damage randomly between all enemies.
338.ability_html: Order: Split 8 damage randomly between all enemies.
338.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
338.flavor: No one knows how he got his nickname – no one's dared to ask.

339.name: Emhyr var Emreis
339.ability: Order: Move a card from the battlefield to your hand, then play a card.
339.ability_html: Order: Move a card from the battlefield to your hand, then play a card.
339.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
339.flavor: They do not call me the Patient. Take care they do not call you the Headless.

340.name: Morvran Voorhis
340.ability:
Order: Reveal a random card from your opponent's deck. If it's bronze, boost an ally by 3. If gold, boost by 4 instead.
On round start, refresh this ability.
340.ability_html: Order: Reveal a random card from your opponent's deck. If it's bronze, boost an ally by 3. If gold, boost by 4 instead. On round start, refresh this ability.
340.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
340.flavor: The summer sun reflected in the quiet waters of the Alba – that's Nilfgaard to me.

341.name: Jan Calveit
341.ability: Order: Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play one.
341.ability_html: Order: Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play one.
341.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
341.flavor: A sword is but one of many tools at a ruler's disposal.

342.name: Francesca Findabair
342.ability: Order: Play a special card from your graveyard.
342.ability_html: Order: Play a special card from your graveyard.
342.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
342.flavor: To live in peace, we first must kill. This is human oppression's cruel finale.

343.name: Eithné
343.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by 1.
Charge: 3.
On round start, refresh Eithné's Charge count.
343.ability_html: Order: Damage a unit by 1. Charge: 3. On round start, refresh Eithné's Charge count.
343.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
343.flavor: The dryad queen has eyes of molten silver, and a heart of cold–forged steel.

344.name: Brouver Hoog
344.ability:
Order: Move a unit to the other row. If it's an enemy, damage it by 2; if it's an ally, boost it by 2. 
Charge: 3.
344.ability_html: Order: Move a unit to the other row. If it's an enemy, damage it by 2; if it's an ally, boost it by 2. Charge: 3.
344.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
344.flavor: That doddery dolt? Ye cannae even tell if he's alive or stuffed!

345.name: King Foltest
345.ability:
Order: Boost an ally by 1 and give it Zeal.
Charge: 3.
345.ability_html: Order: Boost an ally by 1 and give it Zeal. Charge: 3.
345.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
345.flavor: Don't need advisors and their schemes. I place my trust in my soldiers' blades.

346.name: King Henselt
346.ability: Order: Play a copy of an allied unit on the battlefield from your deck, boost it by 4, and give it Zeal.
346.ability_html: Order: Play a copy of an allied unit on the battlefield from your deck, boost it by 4, and give it Zeal.
346.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
346.flavor: King Henselt did not look like a thief, but, with all due respect, that's really what he was.

347.name: Tridam Infantry
347.ability: Whenever this unit receives a boost, damage a random enemy by 1.
347.ability_html: Whenever this unit receives a boost, damage a random enemy by 1.
347.flavor: Soldiers loyal to the old baron of Tridam left the city with Falibor, thus becoming renegades wanted by the law.

348.name: Cerys an Craite
348.ability: If this unit is in the graveyard, Summon it to a random allied row whenever you play a unit from your graveyard.
348.ability_html: If this unit is in the graveyard, Summon it to a random allied row whenever you play a unit from your graveyard.
348.keyword_html: Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
348.flavor: They call me Sparrowhawk. Know why? Because I eat rats like you for breakfast.

349.name: Saskia
349.ability:
Order: Damage an enemy by 2.
Cooldown: 4.
If you have an Elf, Dwarf, or Dryad in your hand, decrease Cooldown by 1 (limited once per category).
349.ability_html: Order: Damage an enemy by 2. Cooldown: 4. If you have an Elf, Dwarf, or Dryad in your hand, decrease Cooldown by 1 (limited once per category).
349.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
349.flavor: I care not for kings and their titles. In the east lives one who truly deserves a crown.

350.name: Skjall
350.ability: Deploy: Damage an undamaged enemy by 4.
350.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an undamaged enemy by 4.
350.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
350.flavor: Strike his name from the Saga of Elders! No one dare grant him shelter or sustenance!

351.name: Jotunn
351.ability: Deploy, Melee: Boost self by 2 for every unit more your opponent has on the battlefield.
351.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Boost self by 2 for every unit more your opponent has on the battlefield.
351.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
351.flavor: Skellige legend claims the mighty and terrible Jotunn, King of Giants, reigned over the isles in ancient times. He was slain by Hemdall, but with his dying breath he vowed to return for Ragh nar Roog.

352.name: Whispess: Tribute
352.ability: Deploy, Ranged: Play an Organic card from your deck.
352.ability_html: Deploy, Ranged: Play an Organic card from your deck.
352.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
352.flavor: I'd be your best – and last.

353.name: Ritual Sacrifice
353.ability_html: Trigger all allies' Deathwish abilities.
353.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
353.flavor: We'll cut you up, boy. A fine broth you'll make.

354.name: Weavess: Incantation
354.ability: Deploy, Melee: Consume a unit in your hand and draw a card.
354.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Consume a unit in your hand and draw a card.
354.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Consume: Eat a unit and boost by its power. If it's on the battlefield, destroy it. If in hand or deck, move it to the graveyard. If in the graveyard, remove it from the game.
354.flavor: I sense your pain. I see your fear.

355.name: Mandrake
355.keyword_html: Reset: Restore a card to its default state (as it would appear in the Deck Builder).
355.flavor: There you all stand! With wonderment awake, doubting the plan and high-discovery. Some, as if grappled by the fell mandrake, some, by the black dog's devilry.

356.name: Crow's Eye
356.ability: Trigger a bronze unit's Deathwish ability.
356.ability_html: Trigger a bronze unit's Deathwish ability.
356.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
356.flavor: A certain famous pirate once so loved this intoxicating herb, he earned the nickname 'Crow's Eye.' The theatrical version of his legend omits this, however, to the great consternation of pirate lore sticklers.

357.name: Vigo's Muzzle
357.ability: Seize an enemy with 5 or less power and Lock it.
357.ability_html: Seize an enemy with 5 or less power and Lock it.
357.keyword_html: Seize: Move an enemy to the opposite row. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
357.flavor: Never has there been a beast Fringilla Vigo could not tame.

358.name: Wolfsbane
358.ability: Damage all enemies with even power by 2, or damage all enemies with odd power by 2.
358.ability_html: Damage all enemies with even power by 2, or damage all enemies with odd power by 2.
358.flavor: Also known as 'the queen of poisons,' wolfsbane is used in many witcher Potions and alchemic brews.

359.name: Pitfall Trap
359.ability: Ambush: Destroy the next unit played by your opponent before it triggers any abilities.
359.ability_html: Ambush: Destroy the next unit played by your opponent before it triggers any abilities.
359.keyword_html: Ambush: Played face down, then flips over when the ability's condition is met.
359.flavor: Simple, cheap and deadly efficient - no wonder it's one of the Scoia'tael's favorite traps.

360.name: Cockatrice
360.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2 for each adjacent Beast.
360.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2 for each adjacent Beast.
360.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
360.flavor: Always strikes between the vertebrae, under your left kidney or straight into your aorta. That way, it only needs to strike once.

361.name: Poor Fucking Infantry
361.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
361.flavor: I's a war veteran! Spare me a crown?

362.name: Lambert: Swordmaster
362.ability: Deploy: Destroy an enemy with Resilience.
362.ability_html: Deploy: Destroy an enemy with Resilience.
362.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the board at round end, then restores it to base power if boosted. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
362.flavor: Go teach your grandma to suck eggs.

363.name: Eskel: Pathfinder
363.ability: Melee: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1.
363.ability_html: Melee: Every turn, on turn end, boost self by 1.
363.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
363.flavor: Heard you panting from three miles away. Just didn't wanna give up that vantage point.

364.name: Vesemir: Mentor
364.ability: Deploy: Boost all Witcher allies in hand, deck, and on the battlefield by 1.
364.ability_html: Deploy: Boost all Witcher allies in hand, deck, and on the battlefield by 1.
364.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
364.flavor: Killing monsters is not something to be taken lightly. Ciri must understand that if she's to become one of us.

365.name: Dwarven Agitator
365.ability: Deploy, Ranged: Boost a Dwarf in your hand by 2.
365.ability_html: Deploy, Ranged: Boost a Dwarf in your hand by 2.
365.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
365.flavor: Mark me words, if ye dinnae get up off yer arses, humans're gonnae come here an' steal our wenches!

366.name: Standard Bearer
366.ability:
Deploy: Boost an ally by 2.
Whenever you Reveal this card, boost a random ally by 2.
366.ability_html: Deploy: Boost an ally by 2. Whenever you Reveal this card, boost a random ally by 2.
366.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
366.flavor: You shall defend this standard if it costs you your lives! Gloir aen Ard Feain!

367.name: Rotfiend
367.ability: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy by 4.
367.ability_html: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy by 4.
367.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
367.flavor: You'll smell them long before you see them.

368.name: Alba Armored Cavalry
368.ability: Deploy, Melee: Lock an enemy unit.
368.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Lock an enemy unit.
368.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
368.flavor: The wedge of riders thundered into the phalanx with crushing momentum. Like a dagger thrust into an exposed belly, the Alba Division swept unhindered through everything between it and the vital organs of the Temerian Infantry.

369.name: Temerian Drummer
369.ability: Order: Boost an ally by 1 and give it Zeal.
369.ability_html: Order: Boost an ally by 1 and give it Zeal.
369.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
369.flavor: Not the career he had in mind when he told mummy he wanted to be a musician.

370.name: Trophy Catch
370.ability: Move an enemy to the other row and damage it by the number of units on that row.
370.ability_html: Move an enemy to the other row and damage it by the number of units on that row.
370.flavor: Skelligers have long known that harpoons are effective against more than mere whales...

371.name: Naglfar
371.ability: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play one and place the other on top.
371.ability_html: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play one and place the other on top.
371.flavor: Waves pummel the shore, waves pushed by the prow of the spectral Naglfar. Hemdall's horn rings in the air, and Hemdall stands facing his enemies atop Bifrost, the burning rainbow. The White Frost is nigh, nigh is the time of gale and storm…

372.name: Chort
372.flavor: A member of the Bovine Defense Force. Semper fi!

373.name: Ice Troll
373.ability: Every turn, on turn end, if you have less units than your opponent, boost self by 1.
373.ability_html: Every turn, on turn end, if you have less units than your opponent, boost self by 1.
373.flavor: Trolls come in many varieties, with differing shapes, sizes and predilections, though always with about as much brains as a bucket of rusty nails.

374.name: Venendal Elite
374.ability: Deploy: If your Leader's ability was used this turn, damage an enemy by 3.
374.ability_html: Deploy: If your Leader's ability was used this turn, damage an enemy by 3.
374.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
374.flavor: Ebbing is famed for its top-notch mercenaries and light cavalry.

375.name: Mahakam Ale
375.ability: Boost a unit by 4 and remove its Lock.
375.ability_html: Boost a unit by 4 and remove its Lock.
375.keyword_html: Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
375.flavor: Considered to be the dwarves' greatest contribution to world culture.

376.name: Éibhear Hattori
376.ability: Order: Play a bronze artifact from your graveyard.
376.ability_html: Order: Play a bronze artifact from your graveyard.
376.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
376.flavor: Only thing that can rival his swords? His dumplings.

377.name: Germain Piquant
377.ability: Deploy, Melee: Spawn 2 Cows on both sides of this unit.
377.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Spawn 2 Cows on both sides of this unit.
377.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
377.flavor: The hero Toussaint needs, but not the one it deserves.

378.name: Heymaey Spearmaiden
378.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 3, then damage self by 2.
378.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 3, then damage self by 2.
378.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
378.flavor: Skellige women are wild and unpredictable. All units are to treat them as serious threats and never underestimate their capabilities. - General Directive to the Invading Forces of the Imperial Armada

379.name: Ronvid the Incessant
379.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 5.
Whenever you play a Soldier, Summon this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
379.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 5. Whenever you play a Soldier, Summon this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
379.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
379.flavor: This self-dubbed knight roams the world defending the honor of his beloved Maid Bilberry - though none are certain where she lives, if she lives still or if she ever lived at all.

380.name: Tainted Ale
380.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Damage a unit by 2. 
Charge: 3.
380.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Damage a unit by 2. Charge: 3.
380.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
380.flavor: That beer supposed to be green…?

381.name: Ale of the Ancestors
381.ability:
Zeal.
Order: Boost a unit by 3. 
Cooldown: 2.
381.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Boost a unit by 3. Cooldown: 2.
381.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
381.flavor: Boros, the legendary founder of Clan Fuchs, died after overindulging in this beverage - he passed out while reaching for his golden ring, which had fallen into a brook.

382.name: She-Troll of Vergen
382.ability: Melee: Whenever an ally is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 2.
382.ability_html: Melee: Whenever an ally is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 2.
382.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
382.flavor: Lover of elf and onion soup.

383.name: Elven Swordmaster
383.ability:
Order, Melee: Damage an enemy by 1.
Cooldown: 2.
Whenever you play an Elf, decrease Cooldown by 1.
383.ability_html: Order, Melee: Damage an enemy by 1. Cooldown: 2. Whenever you play an Elf, decrease Cooldown by 1.
383.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
383.flavor: Combat is a dance, and you must never allow your opponent to lead.

384.name: Slyzard
384.ability:
Order: Consume an allied unit on this row.
Cooldown: 1.
384.ability_html: Order: Consume an allied unit on this row. Cooldown: 1.
384.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Consume: Eat a unit and boost by its power. If it's on the battlefield, destroy it. If in hand or deck, move it to the graveyard. If in the graveyard, remove it from the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
384.flavor: No man alive, no matter his brawn, no matter his skill, can parry a blow dealt by the tail of a slyzard, the pincers of a giant scorpion or the claws of a griffin.

385.name: Aedirnian Mauler
385.ability_html: Order: Damage an enemy by 4.
385.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
385.flavor: Ugh, these guys can be a real headache.

386.name: Geralt: Yrden
386.ability: Deploy: Restore all units on a row to their base power.
386.ability_html: Deploy: Restore all units on a row to their base power.
386.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
386.flavor: He lay down next to Adda's mummified remains, drawing the Yrden Sign on the inner side of her sarcophagus' lid.

387.name: Mahakam Volunteers
387.ability: Deploy, Melee:  If there is a Dwarf on this row, Summon a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.
387.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: If there is a Dwarf on this row, Summon a copy of this unit from your deck to this row.
387.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
387.flavor: Hoooahhh! Hoooaahhh! Hooo! Prepare yer hineys, clowns! Soon we'll be comin' 'round! Tae kick 'em till ye've feet for frowns!

388.name: Harald's Pal
388.ability: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
388.ability_html: Deathwish: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
388.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
388.flavor: Tall one's Wilmar. Wilfred's to his right. And the lad with the stutter's Wilhelm.

389.name: Cow
389.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the unit from the game after it moves to the graveyard.
389.flavor: In Beauclair, everything is better: the wine is sweeter, the cows are bigger and all the ladies are above average.

390.name: An Craite Marauder
390.ability: Deploy, Melee: Split 4 damage randomly between all units.
390.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Split 4 damage randomly between all units.
390.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
390.flavor: You daft? You mean to sail to Skellige? Those barbarians'll tear you to shreds!

391.name: Phoenix
391.ability: On round start, if Phoenix is in your graveyard, Banish it, then Spawn Phoenix Hatchling and Summon it to a random allied row.
391.ability_html: On round start, if Phoenix is in your graveyard, Banish it, then Spawn Phoenix Hatchling and Summon it to a random allied row.
391.keyword_html: Banish: Remove from the game. Does not trigger Deathwish abilities. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
391.flavor: What came first, the chicken or the egg? Compared to the conundrum that is the phoenix, that question seems downright trivial.

392.name: Usurper
392.ability: On game start, disable the enemy Leader for the duration of the battle.
392.ability_html: On game start, disable the enemy Leader for the duration of the battle.
392.flavor: Why should something as trivial as birth decide who rules over us?

393.name: Stribog Runestone
393.ability: Create and play a bronze Skellige card.
393.ability_html: Create and play a bronze Skellige card.
393.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.
393.flavor: Ofieri runemasters can combine these into runewords of incredible power.

394.name: Zoria Runestone
394.ability: Create and play a bronze Northern Realms card.
394.ability_html: Create and play a bronze Northern Realms card.
394.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.
394.flavor: I'm getting a palpable chill from this runestone… did I do something to hurt its feelings?

395.name: Dazhbog Runestone
395.ability: Create and play a bronze Nilfgaard card.
395.ability_html: Create and play a bronze Nilfgaard card.
395.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.

396.name: Devana Runestone
396.ability: Create and play a bronze Monster faction card.
396.ability_html: Create and play a bronze Monster faction card.
396.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.
396.flavor: My blades're so sharp, they can cut paper!

397.name: Morana Runestone
397.ability: Create and play a bronze Scoia'tael card.
397.ability_html: Create and play a bronze Scoia'tael card.
397.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly chosen cards from a specified faction and from neutral cards, unless otherwise specified.
397.flavor: I grow faint at the very sight of it…

398.name: Whispering Hillock
398.ability: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn and play a base copy of it.
398.ability_html: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn and play a base copy of it.
398.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
398.flavor: It will rise again. Elsewhere, beyond our reach. Blood will flow once more.

399.name: Filavandrel aén Fidháil
399.ability: Order: Boost all units in your hand by 1.
399.ability_html: Order: Boost all units in your hand by 1.
399.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
399.flavor: Though we are now few and scattered, our hearts burn brighter than ever.

400.name: Princess Adda
400.ability_html: Order: Damage a unit by 8.
400.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
400.flavor: Her curse was lifted… but her appetite for raw meat remained.

401.name: Eist Tuirseach
401.ability: Order: Play a Warrior from your graveyard.
401.ability_html: Order: Play a Warrior from your graveyard.
401.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
401.flavor: Eist came to Cintra to help Crach an Craite win the hand of Princess Pavetta, yet wound up winning her mother's heart for himself.

402.name: Bone Talisman
402.flavor: The simplest of objects sometimes possess the greatest power.

403.name: Werecat
403.ability:
Thrive.
Deploy: Damage all enemy units on the opposite row by 1.
Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
403.ability_html: Thrive. Deploy: Damage all enemy units on the opposite row by 1. Deathwish: Repeat the Deploy ability.
403.keyword_html: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 whenever an ally with higher power is played. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathwish: Trigger this ability when moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Units that are Banished are not sent to the graveyard.
403.flavor: He hates it when you scratch his belly.

404.name: Werewolf
404.flavor: Some say lycanthropy's contagious - get bit by a werewolf, you turn into one yourself. Witchers know that's nonsense, of course - only a powerful curse can bring on this condition.

405.name: Yennefer's Invocation
405.ability: Choose any unit or artifact on the battlefield and place it at the top of its owner's deck.
405.ability_html: Choose any unit or artifact on the battlefield and place it at the top of its owner's deck.
405.flavor: It's best not to get in Yennefer's way. Especially when she's in a hurry.

406.name: Letho: Kingslayer
406.ability: Deploy: Transform into a copy of another unit on the battlefield without changing power.
406.ability_html: Deploy: Transform into a copy of another unit on the battlefield without changing power.
406.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
406.flavor: Why does this monk wear studded gloves…?

407.name: Forktail
407.ability: Deploy: Damage all other units by 1.
407.ability_html: Deploy: Damage all other units by 1.
407.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
407.flavor: As for forktails, bait them thusly: pound a stake in the soil, bind a goat to it, then hide ye in nearto shrubbery posthaste.

408.name: Slave Hunter
408.ability: Deploy: If there are 4 or more units on the opposite row, Seize the lowest enemy from that row.
408.ability_html: Deploy: If there are 4 or more units on the opposite row, Seize the lowest enemy from that row.
408.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Seize: Move an enemy to the opposite row.
408.flavor: The trick is to break their wills - but not their bodies.

409.name: Slave Infantry
409.ability: Deploy: Transform an allied unit into Slave Infantry.
409.ability_html: Deploy: Transform an allied unit into Slave Infantry.
409.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
409.flavor: A free man's got a choice. A slave's choices are made for him.

410.name: Iorveth's Gambit
410.ability: If you have 4 or more Traps in your starting deck, play 2 of them at random.
410.ability_html: If you have 4 or more Traps in your starting deck, play 2 of them at random.
410.flavor: Iorveth may have only one eye, but his inner vision is unmatched.

411.name: Slave Driver
411.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2. Increase damage by 1 for each Locked unit.
411.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2. Increase damage by 1 for each Locked unit.
411.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Lock: Status that disables a card’s abilities and removes other statuses. Disables and flips over face-down cards.
411.flavor: What drives a slave driver? A solitary purpose: to see his orders carried out to the letter.

412.name: Saesenthessis: Blaze
412.ability:
Order: Damage an enemy by 1. 
Charge: 5.
412.ability_html: Order: Damage an enemy by 1. Charge: 5.
412.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
412.flavor: I inherited my father's ability to assume other forms - well, one other form, in my case.

413.name: Isengrim's Council
413.ability: Look at a random Dwarf, Dryad, and Elf from your deck, then play one.
413.ability_html: Look at a random Dwarf, Dryad, and Elf from your deck, then play one.
413.flavor: Before us lies Elskerdeg Pass, and beyond that, Zerrikania and Hakland. Before us lies a long and dangerous road. If we are to walk it together… let us put aside our mistrust.

414.name: Master of Disguise
414.ability: Order: Swap this unit's power with an enemy's power.
414.ability_html: Order: Swap this unit's power with an enemy's power.
414.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Reach: The distance in rows that you can target.
414.flavor: O Great Sun which dost in Heavens fly, save us from the lice which do so stubbornly infest our bloomers.

415.name: Recruit
415.ability: Deploy: Reveal a random unit in both decks. If yours has higher power, boost self by 2.
415.ability_html: Deploy: Reveal a random unit in both decks. If yours has higher power, boost self by 2.
415.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
415.flavor: His is not to reason why, his is but… to peel one damned spud after another.

416.name: Seltkirk of Gulet
416.ability: Order, Melee: Duel an enemy unit.
416.ability_html: Order, Melee: Duel an enemy unit.
416.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Duel: Units take turns dealing damage equal to their power until one of them is destroyed.
416.flavor: Though famed for his many virtues, his indomitable courage first and foremost, Seltkirk was not spared the fate which met all those killed in the Battle of Upper Aedirn.

417.name: Ointment
417.ability: Boost a bronze Soldier by 2 and repeat its Deploy ability.
417.ability_html: Boost a bronze Soldier by 2 and repeat its Deploy ability.
417.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
417.flavor: Will it help? Who knows. Shouldn't do any harm, though. Probably.

418.name: Vandergrift
418.ability:
Order, Melee: Damage a unit by 1.
Cooldown: 1.
If you control Vandergrift's Blade, damage a unit by 2 instead.
418.ability_html: Order, Melee: Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 1. If you control Vandergrift's Blade, damage a unit by 2 instead.
418.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order ability can be reused.
418.flavor: The general thought the war for the Lormark would end quickly, with minimal losses… yet wound up fighting it for all eternity.

419.name: Kiyan
419.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by Kiyan's Charge count.
Charge: 1.
419.ability_html: Order: Damage a unit by Kiyan's Charge count. Charge: 1.
419.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
419.flavor: We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far.

420.name: Kaedweni Knight
420.ability: Deploy: If played from the deck, boost self by 4.
420.ability_html: Deploy: If played from the deck, boost self by 4.
420.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
420.flavor: Not every man in the Kaedweni Army supports his king's politics. Yet not a single one would dare say that out loud.

421.name: Giant Boar
421.ability: Deploy, Melee: Boost self by 1 for every damaged unit.
421.ability_html: Deploy, Melee: Boost self by 1 for every damaged unit.
421.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
421.flavor: Most men, seeing a massive boar in the woods, mess their trousers and scurry up the nearest tree. A Skelliger, though - he just drools.

422.name: Kaedweni Revenant
422.ability: Order: Damage a unit by 1. If it was destroyed, Spawn a base copy of Kaedweni Revenant and Summon it to this row.
422.ability_html: Order: Damage a unit by 1. If it was destroyed, Spawn a base copy of Kaedweni Revenant and Summon it to this row.
